scenarioDescription:
The HD 210702 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 210702 is a star with 1.61 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.92 times its radius. It is located 176.76 light years away from the solar system.

HD 210702 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 210702 system


HD 210702 b

HD 210702 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2007-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 210702 b is 574.944 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 210702 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 210702 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 210702, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Lick Observatory.
name: HD 210702 - System With 1 Exoplanet
